intro: Lycianthes hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered yellow jalea, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
